item.description: UK property portal Rightmove Plc expects revenue growth to accelerate this year as more prospective buyers take the plunge.

item.description: New World Development Co.’s woes persist as the company recorded a loss of HK$6.6 billion ($849 million) for the first half after writing down the value of properties amid a prolonged real estate slump in Hong Kong.

item.title: Britain Seeks Tech and AI Deal With US Rather Than Full FTA
item.description: The UK will look to negotiate a narrow trade agreement with the US focused on technology and artificial intelligence, rather than revive talks for a full free-trade deal of the sort that stalled during the first Donald Trump administration.

item.title: French Inflation at Four-Year Low Bolsters Case for ECB Cuts
item.description: French inflation retreated to its lowest level in four years, bolstering the case for further interest-rate cuts by the European Central Bank, whose next move is likely to arrive next week.

item.title: Europe Gas Ends Month With Biggest Loss in Year and Record Trade
item.description: European natural gas is ending February with the biggest decline in a year and record trading volumes as market players adjust their outlooks after a tumultuous month.

item.title: IAG Sets €1 Billion Stock Buyback as Profit Beats Estimates
item.description: IAG SA reported quarterly profit that beat analysts’ estimates and set plans to buy back €1 billion ($1.04 billion) in stock, signaling confidence in the longer-term strength of its business.

item.title: Goldman Strategists Warn of Risks for Credit as Tariffs Rattle
item.description: Investors should hedge corporate bond investments because yield premiums may widen if US President Donald Trump’s tariff threats continue to rattle markets, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.

item.title: Sweden’s Economy Grows at Fastest Pace Since 2022 on Exports
item.description: Sweden’s output unexpectedly grew at the fastest pace in 2 1/2 years, exceeding an initial estimate as exports and investments drove a long-awaited recovery of the largest Nordic economy.

item.title: TikTok Boosts Thailand Investment Plans to $8.8 Billion
